subsection_content:
Early recognition of urethritis symptoms will help prevent and treat the disease effectively. Some symptoms of urethritis:
Urinating many times a day, the amount of urine is usually not much, there is a burning sensation along the urethra, the urine is mixed with pus or fresh blood.; The urinary tract is red, swollen, itchy, and has white, green, or yellow-green mucus secretions. This condition appears more often in the early morning.; Feeling pain in the genitals: Pain during intercourse, pain in the lower abdomen; Some other symptoms: Fever, nausea, groin lymph nodes, swollen joints...
When noticing these symptoms, patients should see a doctor as soon as possible. (2)
